page.title: 10TRANSPORT (LAMPHEY)
page.content: Lamphey is served by British Rail. The once busy station,however is now reduced to a single platform and shelter.Trains to and from Paddington and Pembroke Dock stop by request only. Local buses run four times per day from Pembroke Dock to Freshwater East and Tenby,they all call at Lamphey.The National Express to London also calls at Lamphey. The area is also served by the Dyfed County Cars scheme.This provides lifts for anyone with no other means of transport who needs to make an essential journey to hospital,dentist etc.
